solidbase.util
Class PushbackReader

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Reader
      java.io.FilterReader
          solidbase.util.PushbackReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Readable
public class PushbackReader
extends FilterReader

My own PushbackReader. This one has an unlimited buffer and maintains the current line number. It also gives access to the underlying reader. Furthermore, it wraps IOExceptions in a RuntimeException because we are never interested in it.

Author:
René M. de Bloois

Method Detail

getLineNumber

public int getLineNumber()
Returns the current line number.

Returns:

getReader

public Reader getReader()
Returns the underlying reader. But only if the back buffer is empty, otherwise an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Returns:
The underlying reader.

read

public int read()
Read one character. If the buffer contains characters, the character is taken from there. If the buffer is empty, the character is taken from the underlying reader. Carriage returns are filtered out. \r and \r\n are automatically translated to a single \n. The current line number is incremented for each newline encountered.

Overrides:
read in class FilterReader
Returns:
The character read or -1 if no more characters are available.

push

public void push(int ch)
Push a character back into the reader. The current line number is decremented when a newline character is pushed back.

Parameters:
ch - The character to push back. -1 is ignored.

push

public void push(StringBuilder builder)
Push a complete StringBuilder back into the reader. The current line number is decremented for each newline encountered.

Parameters:
builder - The StringBuilder to push back.

push

public void push(String string)
Push a complete String back into the reader. The current line number is decremented for each newline encountered.

Parameters:
string - The String to push back.
